data.title: Issue 31
data.meta_description: All the issues of TV Times on our Newsstand. Get the subscription to TV Times and get your Digital Magazine on your device.
data.text:
DRAMA The Tower NEW MON-THU ITV1 This third series starts nearly two years on from the previous one. But some things don’t change for Gemma Whelan’s character DS Sarah Collins. Dogged in her investigation into a stabbing of a teenager, Sarah stumbles into an undercover operation led by her nemesis, Inspector Kieran Shaw. That’s not going to end well… See page 6 for our interviews with the cast. SPORT Paralympics LIVE SAT-FRI C4, MORE4, CHANNEL 4 STREAMING & C4 SPORT YOUTUBE We have a full week of events but the highlight for me will be the women’s 100m T34 final on Sunday with (hopefully) Hannah Cockroft (above) defending her Tokyo gold. See page 16 DRAMA Grace NEW SUNDAY ITV1 With the fantastic Brighton scenery, DI Branson and Det Supt Grace…

GRACE NEW SUNDAY, 8PM, ITV1 DRAMA John Simm and Richie Campbell sit in an airless Brighton production office, swigging from their water bottles as the sun streams through a nearby window. It’s mid-August and the acclaimed actors are spending the hottest day so far of 2024 filming scenes for ITV1’s Grace when they join TV Times on a video call to discuss Series 4 of the gritty crime drama. ‘We’re actually working on the fifth series at the moment,’ reveals John, mopping his brow. ‘We filmed the fourth one over a year ago, so you’ll have to bear with us while we remember what we were up to!’ Happily, it doesn’t take long for the pair to recollect this week’s opening story, Dead Man’s Time, which is based on the…

Last year’s third season delivered a surprise for Roy Grace when his pathologist partner Cleo Morey revealed she was pregnant. ‘It wasn’t necessarily something Cleo and Roy had talked about or planned, but it’s welcome news,’ says star Zoë Tapper, 42, as she joins TV Times for an exclusive interview. ‘As this year’s series begins, Cleo is still at work, but we can see her bump growing, and both her and Roy are excited about the future.’ However, as fans know, the last season also scattered clues that stormy times may lie ahead for the couple after Roy’s first wife, Sandy, who disappeared over a decade ago, made a mysterious return to Brighton. ‘It’s funny, because all the things that were perhaps problematic about Roy’s relationship with Sandy don’t seem…

THE TOWER NEW MONDAY-THURSDAY, 9PM, ITV1 DRAMA (BOX SET, ITVX) A heady mix of intriguing characters, knotty storylines and unexpected twists, the first two series of crime thriller The Tower left viewers on the edge of their seats. Now, after solving the mysterious deaths of a veteran beat cop and a young refugee who fell together from the roof of a London tower block and unravelling the cold case of a missing teenage girl, dedicated DS Sarah Collins (played by Gemma Whelan) finds herself again colliding with maverick colleague Lizzie Adama (Tahirah Sharif), who has been promoted to detective constable, in the most-dangerous investigation yet… Airing across four consecutive nights this week, the new series of The Tower is based on Gallowstree Lane, the third novel in former detective Kate…

THE VOICE UK NEW SAT, 8PM, ITV1 ENTERTAINMENT There are changes afoot as ITV1 talent search The Voice UK spins back on to our screens this week. Following the departures of Anne-Marie and Olly Murs at the end of the last series, the coaching panel has had a makeover, with the line-up now featuring returnees Sir Tom Jones and will.i.am, along with the new signings of award-winning US singer LeAnn Rimes (see our box, right) and McFly bandmates Danny Jones and Tom Fletcher, who will be sharing a specially designed double red chair! Here, Danny, 38, and Tom, 39, tell us what to expect from Series 13… In a first for The Voice UK, you’ll be sitting in a double seat and must agree on an act in order for…

Born in Mississippi and raised in Texas, singer LeAnn Rimes is thrilled to be taking a seat on The Voice UK – and she knows exactly the type of act she is hoping to find during the Blind Auditions. ‘I listen for someone who can tell a story – it’s about creating that connection and conveying emotion in someone else. If you have that, you have magic,’ enthuses LeAnn, who rose to fame at the age of 13 as a country-music artist and has had hits with songs such as How Do I Live (1997). ‘I’m hands-on and constantly sending emails to my artists, checking in on them, working with them on calming their nerves, on the technicalities of their vocals, and refining their mental game. I’m their biggest cheerleader!’…
